alert.note: Alert for Codington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:14PM MDT until April 17 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Above Lake Kampeska affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Watertown affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Florence affecting Grant County. Mud Creek near Rauville affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Significant amounts of pasture land are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CDT Wednesday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 615 AM CDT.
